basics.name: Storm Selvig
basics.label: Software Engineer & M.Sc. AI/IoT Student
basics.summary: Software engineer with experience in embedded test automation, networking/security teaching assistance, and legacy software modernization. M.Sc. student in Artificial Intelligence and IoT at UiA. I build practical systems in C/C++, Python, and web tech, and Iâ€™m active in UiASub building an ROV.

education.area: Artificial Intelligence and the Internet of Things

work.name: UiASub (ROV Team)
work.summary: Student organization building a Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV). Worked on software solution both topside and embedded.
highlights: Software responsibility in a new student organization (structure, tooling, and technical direction).
Collaboration across software, electronics, and mechanical work.

work.name: Telenor Maritime AS
work.summary: Bachelor thesis in collaboration with Telenor Maritime, focused on modernizing an older software solution and working with legacy code.
highlights: Improved an existing satelite communication system.
Learned and delivered in an existing production-style codebase.

work.name: Ixys AS
work.summary: Built automated test setups for circuit boards.
highlights: Developed automated PCB test setups.
Solved practical testing problems with hardware and software.

work.name: University of Agder
work.summary: Helped students with labs related to networking and security.
highlights: Supported students using Linux VMs and common tooling.
Assisted with traffic capture and analysis using Wireshark.

work.name: Rogaland Industri Automasjon
work.summary: Worked on practical installation and assembly tasks in industrial automation projects.
highlights: Cable routing and fastening in cable trays.
Installed lighting fixtures and helped build electrical cabinets.

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.summary: Responsive portfolio site to showcase projects, skills, and contact info.
highlights: Project pages with filtering and categorization.
Deployed with CI/CD for automated updates.
Modular CSS and JavaScript for maintainable frontend features.

projects.name: AI Dashcam (Autoticket)
projects.summary: AI-powered system for automatic traffic sign detection and recognition.
highlights: Real-time traffic sign detection and recognition using YOLOv11.
FastAPI backend with a lightweight web UI.
Dataset labeling workflow using Label Studio.

projects.name: Smart Clock
projects.summary: STM32-based smart clock with alarms, sensor readings, and live info from APIs.
highlights: Shows time/date and handles recurring alarms (snooze/mute/enable).
Fetches weather + headlines periodically and renders on an LCD UI.
Uses IP-based geolocation at startup to configure time zone and location.

projects.name: Student Activity App (Studak)
projects.summary: Mobile app that helps students find and plan activities based on budget and group size.
highlights: Activity recommendations with filters and real-time results from Firestore.
Authentication and user profiles using Firebase.
Calendar scheduling and invitations with friends.

projects.name: Online Mafia Game (GodforsakenPlace)
projects.summary: Multiplayer online Mafia game with real-time gameplay and role-based actions.
highlights: Lobby system and role-based actions with night/day cycles.
Real-time updates using SignalR.
Backend in ASP.NET Core with an Azure-hosted database.

projects.name: Mario Game
projects.summary: 2D platformer inspired by the classic Mario series.
highlights: Custom-designed levels and physics.
Implemented in C++ with SDL2.
